data.title: Dong-Kyun Ha - Grokipedia
data.snippet:
Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), known professionally as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter known for his deep vocal timbre, wide range, and emotive ballad performances that have established him as a respected vocalist in the Korean music industry.   Born on June 28, 1980, in Seoul, he debuted in 2002 as a member of the short-lived vocal group 7Dayz before joining the boy band Wanted in 2004, where he has continued to perform despite intermittent hiatuses over the years.   His solo career began in 2006 with the release of the single album DQ from WANTED, followed by notable works including the studio albums Stand Alone (2006) and Another Corner (2008), as well as the EPs Mark (2012), Word (2014), and Polygon (2017).  Ha has further broadened his recognition [...] ## Early life

### Early years and background

Ha Dong-kyun was born on June 28, 1980, in Seoul, South Korea, specifically in the Jungnang-gu district (formerly part of Dongdaemun-gu).  His zodiac sign is Cancer, and he is Protestant Christian.  Early profiles list his height as 175 cm and blood type as O.  From childhood, Ha Dong-kyun developed a passion for music, particularly rock and heavy metal genres, listening to bands such as Whitesnake and Mr. Big while participating in rock bands during his youth.  These early experiences nurtured his dream of becoming a musician before his professional entry into the industry in 2002. 

## Career

### 2002–2005: Group debut with 7Dayz and Wanted [...] Polygon (2017).  Ha has further broadened his recognition through frequent appearances on major television music and variety programs, such as I Am a Singer Season 3, Immortal Songs: Singing the Legend, The Call Season 2, Begin Again, and Killing Voice, where his vocal prowess and interpretive skills have been widely praised.  He has also served as a vocal trainer on programs like MIXNINE and taken on radio DJ roles, contributing to his enduring presence in South Korea's entertainment landscape.  Currently signed to M.AR.K Planet, Ha remains active as a performer and collaborator in the industry.

data.title: The Best Ha Dong Travel Guide & Things To Do | ORIGIN VIETNAM
data.snippet:
In particular, it is famous for the oldest silk weaving village in Vietnam, Van Phuc, and other historical and cultural relics. Ha Dong is one of the favorite destinations for many tourists today. Let’s learn more about this unique place with Origin Vietnam.

## 1. Where is Ha Dong?

Ha Dong is a bustling district of Hanoi, Vietnam. About 12 km southwest of the city center and about 33 km south of Noi Bai International Airport. Geographical location:

 Bordering Nam Tu Liem district to the North.
 The South borders Thanh Oai district.
 The East borders Thanh Tri district, Thanh Xuan district.
 The West borders Hoai Duc, Chuong My, Quoc Oai districts.

## 2. How is Ha Dong unique?

Ha Dong is a land rich in cultural traditions and is one of the fastest growing localities in the city. [...] In addition, when visiting Van Phuc, you can also visit traditional silk dyeing workshops. You immerse yourself in the rich cultural space of the villagers and enjoy unique experiences only available here.

### 5.2 Ha Dong Parish Church

Ha Dong Parish Church is a religious symbol located in Ha Dong district. With its solemn beauty and ancient architecture, the parish church is not only a sacred place but also the spiritual and cultural center of the community. With handmade paintings, statues of saints and delicate decorative details. Ha Dong Parish Church creates a sacred, beautiful space and evokes a sense of solemnity. [...] In addition, Van Quan Lake also has many entertainment services. Such as renting air-conditioned boats on the water, basketball courts, badminton and children’s playgrounds. In particular, the sunset at Van Quan Lake is a beautiful scene with the sunlight shimmering on the water. This place has become an indispensable part of social life in Ha Dong, bringing a natural space and interesting entertainment for everyone.

### 5.4 Ngoi Pagoda

Ngoi Pagoda is located in Ha Dong district, Hanoi, a spiritual and cultural relic with unique characteristics. Ngoi Pagoda is closely associated with the history and soul of the local community, attracting a large number of believers and visitors.

data.title: Hanoi - Wikipedia
data.snippet:
In 1408, the Chinese Ming dynasty attacked and occupied Vietnam, changing Đông Đô's name to Dongguan (Chinese: 東關; Vietnamese: _Đông Quan_; lit. 'eastern gate'). In 1428, the Lam Sơn uprising, under the leadership of Lê Lợi, overthrew the Chinese rule. Lê Lợi founded the Lê dynasty and renamed Đông Quan to Đông Kinh (東京) or Tonkin. During 17th century, the population of Đông Kinh was estimated by Western diplomats as about 100,000.(

### Nguyễn dynasty and the French colonial period

[edit] [...] ### Thăng Long, Đông Đô, Đông Quan, Đông Kinh

[edit]

In 1010, Lý Thái Tổ, the first ruler of the Lý dynasty, moved the capital of Đại Việt to the site of the Đại La Citadel. Claiming to have seen a dragon ascending the Red River, he renamed the site Thăng Long (昇龍). Thăng Long remained the capital of Đại Việt until 1397, when it was moved to Thanh Hóa, then known as Tây Đô (西都), the "Western Capital". Thăng Long then became Đông Đô (東都), the "Eastern Capital". [...] Image 26: Map of Hà Nội citadel during the Nguyễn dynasty. Map of Hà Nội citadel during the Nguyễn dynasty. 
   Image 27: French troops attacking the city's wall on 20 November 1873. French troops attacking the city's wall on 20 November 1873. 
   Image 28: French troops leaving Hanoi in February 1874. French troops leaving Hanoi in February 1874. 
   Image 29: Ô Quan Chưởng or Đông Hà môn (東河門), built in 1749., built in 1749.") Ô Quan Chưởng or Đông Hà môn (東河門), built in 1749. 
   Image 30: Old street of Hanoi in 1884 (Hàng Gai street)..") Old street of Hanoi in 1884 (Hàng Gai street). 
   Image 31: Old street of Hanoi in 1884 (Hàng Bông street)..") Old street of Hanoi in 1884 (Hàng Bông street).

data.title: Overview of the Privacy Act - Department of Justice
data.snippet: In several cases, the courts have found that an agency satisfied its section (e)(2) obligations by giving an individual an opportunity to provide information, even if the individual did not actually provide it.  See Olivares v. NASA, No. 95-2343, 1996 WL 690065, at \2-3 (4th Cir. Dec. 3, 1996) (finding that defendant had contacted plaintiff directly before contacting universities to verify academic credentials where plaintiff was given opportunity to provide information in his employment application and personal interview), aff’g per curiam 882 F. Supp. 1545 (D. Md. 1995); Hubbard v. EPA, 809 F.2d 1, 6 n.8 (D.C. Cir. 1986) (defendant was not forbidden from using relevant information from third parties in hiring decision and made “practicable” effort to collect information from plaintiff [...] obtained report by subpoena), aff’d, 79 F.3d 1145 (5th Cir. 1996) (unpublished table decision); Kassel v. VA, 709 F. Supp. 1194, 1203 (D.N.H. 1989) (granting summary judgement where board of inquiry did speak with plaintiff before completing its report); Beckette v. USPS, No. 88-802, slip op. at 10 (E.D. Va. July 3, 1989) (finding subsection (e)(2) requirements satisfied where information contained in records was derived from other records containing information collected directly from individual); cf. Conyers v. VA, No. 16-CV-00013, 2018 WL 1867106 (E.D.N.Y Jan. 29, 2018) (magistrate’s recommendation) (finding plaintiff’s claim that department intentionally and willfully failed to collect information directly from him to be attack on defendant’s decision-making rather than on [...] memos did not clear up questions), aff’d in pertinent part & rev’d in part sub nom.  McCready v. Nicholson, 465 F.3d 1 (D.C. Cir. 2006) (remanding for reasonable opportunity to complete discovery on count brought pursuant to subsection (e)(2) which did not require administrative exhaustion of remedies); Felsen v. HHS, No. CCB-95-975, slip op. at 62-65 (D. Md. Sept. 30, 1998) (granting defendants’ summary judgment on alternative ground on subsection (e)(2) claim due to “lack of a ‘practicable’ need to collect information directly from the plaintiffs”); Magee v. USPS, 903 F. Supp. 1022, 1028-29 (W.D. La. 1995) (granting summary judgement where plaintiff refused to hand over medical report in face-to-face meeting and postmaster eventually obtained report by subpoena), aff’d, 79 F.3d 1145

data.title: Travel advice and advisories for Vietnam - Travel.gc.ca
data.snippet:
licence suspension
 heavy fines

If you are involved in a traffic accident as a driver, you may:

 face criminal charges as a driver
 have to pay compensation to the victims
 face a travel ban preventing you from leaving the country until compensation is paid

There are restrictions on vehicles crossing from and into neighbouring countries.

Contact the Department of Transport in Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh City for information on for licences or restrictions.

Department of Transport in Ho Chi Minh City (in Vietnamese)

### Money

The currency of Vietnam is the Vietnamese dong (VND).

#### Cash declarations

##### Arrival

Upon arrival, you must declare if you have: [...] get vaccinated against mpox if you’re eligible
 practise safer sex methods
  + use barrier protection during sexual activity, like condoms and dental dams.

Mpox vaccines  
Sexual health and travel  
HIV and AIDS: Travel health advice

Tuberculosis

Tuberculosis is an infection caused by bacteria and usually affects the lungs.

For most travellers the risk of tuberculosis is low.

Travellers who may be at high risk while travelling in regions with risk of tuberculosis should discuss pre- and post-travel options with a health care professional.

High-risk travellers include those visiting or working in prisons, refugee camps, homeless shelters, or hospitals, or travellers visiting friends and relatives.

Multidrug-resistant gonorrhea [...] Enlarge map

## Vietnam travel advice

Disclaimer

The features in this map do not constitute an authoritative source of geographical information. This map is solely intended to assist Canadians by illustrating the risk levels contained in the Travel Advice and Advisories for this destination. The features in this map do not necessarily represent the views of the Canadian government on international boundaries, nomenclature or political status. The text under the Risk levels section takes precedence over this map.

### Vietnam - Exercise a high degree of caution

Exercise a high degree of caution in Vietnam due to high rate of petty crime.

Back to top

data.title: Climate Analytics: Homepage
data.snippet:
### Climate ambition support

Supporting climate-vulnerable countries in strengthening their roles and voices in international climate negotiations.

 Read more about Climate ambition support Read more

### Advancing knowledge on loss and damage in the Caribbean

The IsLanD Advancement project aims to improve access to loss and damage finance in the Caribbean through better data and awareness raising.

 Read more about Advancing knowledge on loss and damage in the Caribbean Read more

Explore our projects

## Offices

### Australia and Pacific

### North America

### South Asia [...] Explore our tools

## Publications

22 December 2025

### Decarbonising electricity, cement, iron and steel, and chemicals in Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina and Serbia

This four-part series explores technical and policy decarbonisation opportunities for the Western Balkans in key industries affected by the EU's incoming Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM).

Publications

19 December 2025

### AEMO's gas projections for Western Australia: analysis

The Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO) has just released its gas projections for Western Australia, the results of which highlight the absence of climate policies in the state.

Publications

18 December 2025

### Troubled waters: risks and realities of blue carbon in climate action [...] Publications

19 November 2025

### Three key near-term actions could bend the warming curve; bringing projected warming below 2°C

Tripling renewables, doubling energy efficiency and cutting methane by 2030 and beyond would cut warming rate by a third in ten years, and halve it by 2040. This would cut projected warming this century about 0.9˚C from 2.6˚C to 1.7˚C.

All publications

## Comment

12 December 2025

### The Paris Agreement is working. Ten years later, the world needs to finish the job.

Whether the Agreement ultimately succeeds depends on whether political leaders and their governments have the courage to close the ambition gap, phase out fossil fuels, scale up finance for a just transition, and protect people already facing mounting loss and damage.

8 November 2025
